message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.DC, cs.MM

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper proposes a new random linear network coding scheme for reliable communications, which is a topic closely related to information theory. 
2. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper deals with communication protocols and network coding schemes, which are topics related to networking and internet architecture. 
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper discusses the performance of the proposed scheme in terms of mean completion time and throughput, which are topics related to systems and control. 
4. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper proposes a distributed coding scheme for reliable communications, which is a topic related to distributed computing. 
5. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper discusses the performance of the proposed scheme in terms of packet error probability, which is a topic related to multimedia communication.
